Meteor.Graphics.Images

Class ImageUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • Meteor.Graphics.Images.ImageUtils

  • public class ImageUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    ImageUtils is an image utility class.
    This class can be used to manipulate images.

    • Method Detail

      • crop

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage crop(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                int xPos,
                                                int yPos,
                                                int cellWidth,
                                                int cellHeight)
        Crops the image into a given width and height based on the inputed x-coordinate, and y-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to be cropped.
        xPos - The x-coordinate of the item to crop.
        yPos - The y-coordinate of the item to crop.
        cellWidth - The width of the cell.
        cellHeight - The height of the cell.
        Returns:
        The cropped portion of the image.

      • crop

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage crop(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                int xPos,
                                                int yPos,
                                                int imageSize)
        Crops the image into a given width and height based on the inputed x-coordinate, and y-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be cropped.
        xPos - The x-coordinate of the item to crop.
        yPos - The y-coordinate of the item to crop.
        imageSize - The size of the image.
        Returns:
        The cropped portion of the image.

        Method used to rotate an image based on an inputed degree value.
        Parameters:
        image - The image file to rotate.
        degrees - The amount of rotation in degrees.
        Returns:
        The rotated image file.

                            int format)
        Method used to grab the pixel data of a given image file.
        Parameters:
        image - The image file used to grab the pixel data of.
        format - The format of the image (e.g. rgba).
        Returns:
        The array of pixel data.

                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage b)
        Method used to compare two given images.
        Parameters:
        a - The image to compare against.
        b - The image to compare with.
        Returns:
        Weather or not the two images are the same.

        Parameters:
        type - The type of image (e.g. BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB).
        image - The image to convert.
        Returns:
        The converted image.

      • getAsSpritesheet

        public static Spritesheet getAsSpritesheet(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                           int cellWidth,
                                           int cellHeight)
        Converts a BufferedImage into a Spritesheet with rectangular cell size.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to convert.
        cellWidth - Width of each sub-image within the spritesheet.
        cellHeight - Height of each sub-image within the spritesheet.
        Returns:
        The newly created spritesheet resource.

      • load

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage load(java.io.InputStream in)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a BufferedImage externally or locally through an InputStream. This can be used to load assets within a .jar executable by calling: className.class.getResourceAsStream(String res);
        Parameters:
        in - Data source to stream.
        Returns:
        Loaded resource.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When path to the resource is invalid and/or resource cannot be loaded.

      • load

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage load(java.io.InputStream in,
                                                float scale)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a BufferedImage externally or locally through an InputStream with custom scaling. This can be used to load assets within a .jar executable by calling: className.class.getResourceAsStream(String res);
        Parameters:
        in - Data source to stream.
        scale - Scale of the resource, 1.0f is 1:1 ratio.
        Returns:
        Loaded resource.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When path to the resource is invalid and/or resource cannot be loaded.

      • load

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage load(java.lang.String filePath,
                                                float scale)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a BufferedImage in a specified external directory with custom scaling.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path to resource.
        scale - Scale of resource, 1.0f is normal 1:1 scaling.
        Returns:
        Loaded resource.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When path to the resource is invalid and/or resource cannot be loaded.

      • render

        public static void render(Context ctx,
                          java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                          int xPos,
                          int yPos)
        Method used to render an image to the screen or game window object.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The Game render 'canvas'.
        image - The image file.
        xPos - The x-coordinate relative to the screen to place the image.
        yPos - The y-coordinate relative to the screen to place the image.
